unnormalised: The Amarnath Yatra 2024 is expected to see a surge in pilgrims, with registration already exceeding 2 lakh as of 15/06/2024. Officials are prepping for a smooth journey to the holy cave, located at a height of 3,888 meters in the Himalayas. Pilgrims are advised to register online through the official Shri Amarnathji Shrine Board (SASB) website or designated bank branches.
normalised: The Amarnath Yatra two thousand and twenty four is expected to see a surge in pilgrims, with registration already exceeding two lakh as of fifteenth June two thousand and twenty four. Officials are prepping for a smooth journey to the holy cave, located at a height of three thousand eight hundred and eighty eight meters in the Himalayas. Pilgrims are advised to register online through the official Shri Amarnathji Shrine Board (S-A-S-B) website or designated bank branches.

unnormalised: The Char Dham Yatra in Uttarakhand has also witnessed a record number of devotees. As of 30/05/2024, over 10 lakh pilgrims have visited Kedarnath, Badrinath, Gangotri, and Yamunotri. The state government is working to improve infrastructure and provide better facilities for the yatris. Expect delays due to weather conditions and landslides, esp during the monsoon.

The state government is working to improve infrastructure and provide better facilities for the yatris. Expect delays due to weather conditions and landslides, especially during the monsoon.

unnormalised: Varanasi, also known as Kashi, continues to be a popular destination for religious tourism. The Kashi Vishwanath Temple Trust reported over 1 crore visitors in 2023. The city's ghats along the Ganges River are packed with devotees performing rituals and seeking blessings. A dip in the Ganga is considered auspicious and cleanses sins.

unnormalised: The Golden Temple in Amritsar, Punjab, remains a significant pilgrimage site for Sikhs worldwide. The Langar Sewa, a community kitchen serving free meals to all visitors regardless of caste or creed, feeds approximately 100,000 people daily. Pilgrims can visit the temple 24/7, 365 days a year. Consider visiting during Gurpurab celebrations for a vibrant experience.

unnormalised: The Basilica of Bom Jesus in Goa, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, attracts Christian pilgrims from around the globe. The relics of St. Francis Xavier are enshrined here. Masses are held daily in multiple languages, including English, Konkani, and Portuguese. The feast of St. Francis Xavier, celebrated on 03/12 every year, draws huge crowds.
